en: Then Job answered and said,
hmr: Chun, Job chun a dawn a, a hril tah a:

en: Hear diligently my speech; And let this be your consolations.
hmr: “Ka ṭawng hi nguntakin lo ngai unla, Hi hi in inhnêmna chu ni raw se.

en: Suffer me, and I also will speak; And after that I have spoken, mock on.
hmr: Mi phal unla, kei khawma thu hril vêng ka tih, Ka hril zoah mi nuisan de ti niu.

en: As for me, is my complaint to man? And why should I not be impatient?
hmr: Ka chungthua chun, ka chierna hi mihriem chung am a nih? Iengdingin am lunginrawm loin um ka ta?

en: Mark me, and be astonished, And lay your hand upon your mouth.
hmr: Mi en unla, makti unla, in kutin in bau chu hup el ro.

en: Even when I remember I am troubled, And horror taketh hold on my flesh.
hmr: Ka ngaituoin ka lung a zîng a, Ṭitnain ka tisaah a mi man hlak.

en: Wherefore do the wicked live, Become old, yea, wax mighty in power?
hmr: Iengtiziea mi rilo chu hringin, an hung tarin, thilthawtheinaa an hung nasa hlak am a na?

en: Their seed is established with them in their sight, And their offspring before their eyes.
hmr: An thlahai chu anni mithmu ngeia anni le tungding an na, An chithlahai an mithmu ngeiah, tungding an nih.

en: Their houses are safe from fear, Neither is the rod of God upon them.
hmr: An inhai chu ṭitnaa inthawkin a him a, Pathien hmawl khawm chu an chungah a um bawk nawh.

en: Their bull gendereth, and faileth not; Their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.
hmr: An bâwngchalhai chun chi an thlah a, an ching ngai nawh a, An bâwngpuihai chun tê an nei a, tê an insiet ngai nawh.

en: They send forth their little ones like a flock, And their children dance.
hmr: An nauhai chu berâm ruol angin an tir suok a, An nauhai chu an lâm a.

en: They sing to the timbrel and harp, And rejoice at the sound of the pipe.
hmr: Ṭingṭang le khuongtê leh hla an sak a, Theihle ria chun an hlim bawk a.

en: They spend their days in prosperity, And in a moment they go down to Sheol.
hmr: An nihai chu neinungtakin an hmang zo a, Thlamuongtakin Seola chun an fe thla tah a.

en: And they say unto God, Depart from us; For we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.
hmr: Pathien kuoma chun, ‘keinia inthawkin fe hmang rawh, I lampuihai hrietna chu kan châk naw a nih,’ an la ti ta rawp a.

en: What is the Almighty, that we should serve him? And what profit should we have, if we pray unto him?
hmr: ‘Iengkimthawthei chu tu am a ni leh, a rawng ei bâwl ding chu? A kuoma ei ṭawngṭaiin ieng am ṭhathnemna hmûng ei ta?’ tiin.

en: Lo, their prosperity is not in their hand: The counsel of the wicked is far from me.
hmr: En ta u, an hausakna chu an kutah a um nawh a; Mi rilo thurâwn chu keimaa inthawka hlataka chun a um a nih.

en: How oft is it that the lamp of the wicked is put out? That their calamity cometh upon them? That God distributeth sorrows in his anger?
hmr: Mi rilohai khâwnvar chu ieng anga herhlum rawpin am a um a? An sietna khawm chu ieng angin am a hung rawp ding? Pathien khawm chun a lunginsenin lungngainahai a pêk tâwl chu?

en: That they are as stubble before the wind, And as chaff that the storm carrieth away?
hmr: Thli hmaa pâwl kûng ang el an na, Busi thliin a lên hmang hlak ang chu an nih.

en: Ye say, God layeth up his iniquity for his children. Let him recompense it unto himself, that he may know it:
hmr: ‘Pathien chun a thlahai ta dingin a khawhlona chu a khâwlkhâwm,’ in ta, An hriet theina dingin an chunga ngei chun thung ni raw se.

en: Let his own eyes see his destruction, And let him drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
hmr: An mithai chun an sietna ngei chu hmu sienla, Iengkimthawthei lunginsenna ngei chu indâwntirin um raw hai se,

en: For what careth he for his house after him, When the number of his months is cut off?
hmr: An thi hnung chun an insûng chu ieng dim ni tâng an ta, An ta dinga thla tiem zât a bo hnung chun?

en: Shall any teach God knowledge, Seeing he judgeth those that are high?
hmr: Mi tukhawmin Pathien chu hrietthiemna ân chûktir ding am a nih, Mi insânghai chunga chun ro a rêl ti hmu siin?

en: One dieth in his full strength, Being wholly at ease and quiet:
hmr: Mi chu a hrât lai takin a thih a, To ṭawk ṭawk le sâwldam rawng rawnga umin.

en: His pails are full of milk, And the marrow of his bones is moistened.
hmr: A taksa chu thâuin a sip a, A ruhai thlin chu a tlawr bawk a.

en: And another dieth in bitterness of soul, And never tasteth of good.
hmr: Chun mi dang lungngaitakin a thih a, Thil ṭha hrim hrim ân tem ngai nawh.

en: They lie down alike in the dust, And the worm covereth them.
hmr: Pilvuta chun angkhat charin an zâl ve veh a, Anni chu ngehai chun ân khum a nih.

en: Behold, I know your thoughts, And the devices wherewith ye would wrong me.
hmr: Ngai ta u, in ngaituohai ka hriet deh Keima chunga indik nawtaka inngaituona remruotnahai le chun.

en: For ye say, Where is the house of the prince? And where is the tent wherein the wicked dwelt?
hmr: ‘Lalnau in chu khâwlai am a na? Mi rilo umna puon in chu khâwlai am a na?’ in ti sih a.

en: Have ye not asked wayfaring men? And do ye not know their evidences,
hmr: Lampuia mi inlawnhai chu in indawn naw am a nih? An thuhrilhai chu in pawm naw am a nih?

en: That the evil man is reserved to the day of calamity? That they are led forth to the day of wrath?
hmr: Mi suol chu suksietna nia dinga khêk a na, Ṭhuoihmangin an um a, lunginsenna nia dingin.

en: Who shall declare his way to his face? And who shall repay him what he hath done?
hmr: Tuin am a lampui chu a hmaisana chun hrilfieng a ta? A thil lo thaw ta chu tuin am thungpêk a ti leh?

en: Yet shall he be borne to the grave, And men shall keep watch over the tomb.
hmr: Thlâna chun ama chu phur hmang la nîng a ta, Thlân in chunga chun la nghâk an tih.

en: The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, And all men shall draw after him, As there were innumerable before him.
hmr: Varuom piltlanghai chu ama ta dingin inhnik a ta, Chun, mi po po chun ama hnung chu zui an tih, A hmaa mi tiem sêng lo lo um tahai ang khan.

en: How then comfort ye me in vain, Seeing in your answers there remaineth only falsehood?
hmr: Anleh, iengtin am teplo chun mi thlamuon in ta, In dawnnahaia chun khêl ngawt naw chu iengkhawm a um nawh,” tiin.
